definition: two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
a couple of times/to repeat the same/the same old trick/tricks of the trade
to have real skill/to know one's stuff

sentences.english: The car turned over twice,left the road,and ploughed into the wall.
sentences.chinese: 這輛汽車翻了兩下，離開了馬路，猛撞到一堵牆上。

sentences.english: They decided to settle their debts with their creditors, and call it quits.
sentences.chinese: 他們商議決定以資抵債，兩下扯平。

sentences.english: He went and fetched his pneumatic drill and smashed the house down.
sentences.chinese: 他拿來了氣泵鑽，三下兩下，就把房子給鑽塌了。

sentences.english: The goalkeeper bounced the ball twice before kicking it.
sentences.chinese: 守門員把球拍了兩下之後一腳踢出去。

sentences.english: The chairman rapped on the table twice with his gavel .
sentences.chinese: 主席用他的小木槌在桌上重敲了兩下。

sentences.english: If you double-click a word in the document, that word is selected.
sentences.chinese: 如果您按兩下文件中的某個文字，便會選取該文字。

sentences.english: I remember thinking, "Yea, this guy gets it."
sentences.chinese: 我記得當時想，“喲，這個傢伙有兩下子。
你模仿的還真有兩下子。

sentences.english: The mule caught the cameltwo kicks in the ribs.
sentences.chinese: 那騾子照駱駝的肋部踢了兩下。

sentences.english: He just cut two, saw a small red hat.
sentences.chinese: 他剛剪了兩下，就看到了紅色的小帽子。

sentences.english: It curled up and writhed about painfully, then quickly sank to the bottom, dead as a doornail.
sentences.chinese: 蟲子縮成一團，痛苦的掙扎兩下後，就沉到杯底死了。

sentences.english: I dabbed my lips with a paper napkin.
sentences.chinese: 我拿起一塊紙巾在嘴脣上蘸了兩下。

sentences.english: Small one, you have tow down son.
So either my guthas gone all crazy, or maybe you're the real deal.
sentences.chinese: 要麼是我徹底瘋掉了，要麼是你真的有兩下子。

sentences.english: Novices can figure it out in two clicks.
sentences.chinese: 如果你是新手，可以點擊兩下，然後弄明白。

sentences.english: Helen: Your child is really something. She got the 1st prize in the piano contest.
sentences.chinese: 你的孩子真有兩下子，居然在鋼琴比賽中獲得第一名。

definition: to open one's mouth (to speak, esp. to make a request)/to gape
a moment/a while/in a moment/now...now.../also pr. [yi1 hui3 r5]
to release/to let go/to loosen/to untie/to come loose
to leap and frisk about (idiom); lively/healthy and active
a burst/a fit/a peal/a spell (period of time)
to overdo it/to overstep the limit/excessively/above one's head/overhead
to rotate (about an axis)/to revolve/to turn/to move in a circle/to gyrate
